commitResults.messageBody:
- Duke now stores user tasks and displays tasks when given "list" command.
- Duke is now instanced.
Task class represents a user's tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added ability to mark tasks as done
commitResults.messageBody: Duke now marks a task as done when user inputs "done X", where X is the task number to be marked as done.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add todo, deadline and event classes
commitResults.messageBody:
- Todo class represents a task without any date/time
- Deadline class represents a task that needs to be done before a specific date/time
- Event class represents a task that starts and ends at a specific time

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for tracking todos, events, deadlines
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add todos using the command "todo"
- Add deadlines using the command "deadline". Deadlines must include a due date after the "/by" keyword.
- Add events using the command "event". Events must include a time after the "/at" keyword.

Duke now handles these errors: 
- Invalid command
- Done command without providing task number/invalid task number
- Any task command without providing a task description
- Deadline or event command without providing due date or time respectively

Test cases for automated text-UI testing updated

- Duke now deletes tasks with the keyword "delete" followed by the number of the task to be deleted.
- Automated text-UI tests updated.

- Added packages for Duke and Duke.Task
- Refactor Main function into Main.java file
Abstracted task list and related functions (e.g. add, delete, setDone) into separate TaskList class.

- Duke now saves tasks to a text file whenever changes are made to the task list.
- Storage is abstracted into its own class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Storage class to use date objects
commitResults.messageBody: Storage class now works with LocalDateTime objects.

commitResults.messageTitle: Extract user interaction into Ui class
Edit code to follow coding standard

commitResults.messageBody: Users can now search their task lists using the 'find' command.
